summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from May 30, 2023, discussing a potential new minor victim of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Leon Black. It references a prior review of allegations against Black and others, which was deemed not viable for prosecution, and coordinates a meeting to discuss the new information.

persons.name: Leon Black

events.title: Email Correspondence on New Allegations
events.description: Email chain discussing information about a potential new minor victim of Epstein, Maxwell, and Leon Black, and coordinating a meeting to discuss it.

events.title: Prior Review of Black Allegations
events.description: Reference to due diligence or a review conducted "a couple years ago" regarding allegations against Leon Black, which was determined not to be viable for prosecution.

keyFacts: The correspondence reveals information about a potential new minor victim of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and financier Leon Black.
It references a prior review of allegations against Leon Black (and potentially others) that was concluded to be not viable for prosecution.
The information about the new minor victim came from a civil attorney who previously represented one victim and now represents the minor.
The emails are coordinating a meeting to discuss this new information, indicating an ongoing investigative interest.
